page.title: 10 Finger Farm near Mells
page.content: On Tuesday 25th June we went to Finger Farm. The farmer showed us around the farm. He had a dog named Toby which is black with a white star on his neck. He showed us the cows and then he said if you come back soon you can see the cows being milked. Then he showed us around the herring bone milking parlour. There were eight cows each side and when they had finished being milked the cups came off automatically. The cows were eating their food while the farmer was milking them. Then we went out of the milking room and the farmer showed us where he put the cows' food in the yard and he told us that the collars round the cows' necks were there to send a signal to the computer every time the cows came for food and each cow automatically got the right amount of food.
